DOC.brief_summary: Drops of either saline or phenylephrine are placed in the nose of infants less than 12 months of age to determine if it helps them to breathe easier.
DOC.brief_title: The Use of Nasal Phenylephrine in Infants With Bronchiolitis
DOC.criteria: Age 4 weeks to 12 months; admitting diagnosis of bronchiolitis; admitted to hospital's bronchiolitis pathway, admitted during weekdays, need for nasal suctioning. Congenital heart disease, history of hypertension, previous wheezing, prior use of inhaled corticosteroids, gestational age at birth of <34 weeks.
